Genetic Map

Source: vignettes/Haplotype_and_Map.Rmd
Haplotype_and_Map.Rmd

Introduction

This vignette outlines the process of haplotype reconstruction and genetic map estimation for an F2 population, using Hidden Markov Models (HMM) and recombination frequency (RF) data. The primary goal is to reconstruct haplotypes from genotype data, estimate genotyping error rates, and generate high-quality genetic maps based on recombination frequency matrices.

By leveraging the MapRtools and HMM R packages, this analysis allows for the optimization of marker order and the visualization of haplotype and genetic maps. Additionally, the workflow includes the plotting of Marey plots to explore the relationship between physical and genetic distances.

This approach is applied across multiple chromosomes, using both reference genome order and optimized marker order.

Libraries 

library(ggplot2)
library(MapRtools)
library(tidyr)
library(tidyverse)
library(HMM)

Load Data 

# Ordered Markers
url1 <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/vegaalfaro/geneticMapRFiles/main/R_data/ordered_markers.RData"

# Download file
if (!file.exists("ordered_markers.RData")) {
  download.file(url1, destfile = "local_copy.ordered_markers.RData")}

# Load
load("local_copy.ordered_markers.RData")

Functions

Transition Matrix for F2

This function calculates the transition matrix for a recombination frequency r based on the F2 population model:


T.mat <- function(r){
  s <- 1 - r
  mat <- rbind(
    c(s^2, 2*r* s, r^2),
    c(r*s, s^2 + r^2, r*s),
    c(r^2, 2*r*s, s^2)
  )
  rownames(mat) <- colnames(mat) <- c("0", "1", "2")
  return(mat)
}
